content:
Got it!

**Dining out expenses**: It's great that you're aware of your dining out expenses and trying to cut back. Consider allocating that $20-30 towards your grocery budget to support your healthier eating goals.

**Online grocery shopping**: That's a fantastic idea! Online grocery shopping can save you time, reduce impulse buys, and help you stick to your list. Many online grocery platforms also offer sales, discounts, and loyalty programs that can help you save even more.

**Instacart experience**: Instacart is a popular online grocery shopping platform that partners with local stores. It's great that you had a positive experience with them! If you're considering using Instacart regularly, you might want to explore their loyalty program, Instacart Express, which offers unlimited free delivery on orders over $35.

To make the most of online grocery shopping, here are some tips:

1. **Plan your meals and make a list**: Before you start shopping online, plan your meals for the week and make a list of the ingredients you need. This will help you avoid impulse buys and ensure you're only buying what you need.
2. **Check for sales and discounts**: Look for sales, discounts, and promotions on the online platform or through the store's website. You can often find digital coupons, buy-one-get-one-free deals, or other offers that can help you save.
3. **Choose the right store**: If you have multiple store options on the online platform, choose the one that offers the best prices and selection for your needs.
4. **Consider delivery or pickup options**: Depending on your schedule and preferences, you might want to choose delivery or pickup options that work best for you.
5. **Review and adjust**: After a few online shopping trips, review your expenses and adjust your shopping habits as needed.

By incorporating online grocery shopping into your routine, you can save time, reduce impulse buys, and make healthier eating easier and more convenient.

How do you think you'll balance online grocery shopping with your meal prep habits? Will you still shop in-store for certain items or stick to online shopping for most of your groceries?
